summary: An Ordinance providing for the improvement of Fourteenth Avenue Northeast, from East Forty-fifth Street to East Fifty-sixth Street; Brooklyn Avenue, from East Forty-fifth Street to East Fifty-sixth Street; East Forty-seventh Street, from Tenth Avenue Northwest to Fifteenth Avenue Northeast, East Fiftieth Street, from Tenth Avenue Northeast to Fifteenth Avenue Northeast; East Fifty-second Street, from Tenth Avenue Northeast to Fifteenth Avenue Northeast, East Fifty-fifth Street, from Brooklyn Avenue to Fifteenth Avenue Northeast; East Fifty-sixth Street, from Fourteenth Avenue Northeast to Fifteenth Avenue Northeast; all in the City of Seattle, by grading and curbing the same, and by constructing all necessary concrete sidewalks, catch basins and inlets for surface drainage in accordance with Resolution No. 239 of the City Council of the City of Seattle, and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Payment by Bonds," as provided by an act of the Legislature of the State of Washington, entitled "An act authorizing the issuance and sale of bonds by cities, to pay for local improvements, providing for the payment thereof, and declaring an emergency," approved March 14, 1899, and Ordinance No. 5693 of said city, approved December 6, 1899.
